definition: to lose one's life/to get killed
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: They might be,for example,in an accident, and come close to being killed,but walk away without a scratch.
sentences.chinese: 比如说在事故中幸存，差点送命，但结果毫发无伤。

sentences.english: I figured instead of killing other people, I’d just put the truck in the ditch.
sentences.chinese: 我在想的是为了避免别人送命，我得将卡车开向路堤。

sentences.english: A car crash killed Lily and James Potter?
sentences.chinese: 车祸能让莉莉和詹姆送命？

sentences.english: Well, at least that poor goat won't have died in vain.
sentences.chinese: 那样，至少可怜的山羊就算没有白白送命了。

sentences.english: They all told me that I would die. They begged me not to have a baby.
sentences.chinese: 他们所有人都求我别生下这个孩子，说我会因此送命。

sentences.english: I figured instead of killing other people, I'd just put the truck in the ditch.
sentences.chinese: 我在想的是为了避免别人送命，我得将卡车开向路堤。

sentences.english: The gunfighter knows a poor shot can get him killed.
sentences.chinese: 枪战能手懂得一次失败的射击会让他送命。

sentences.english: I wonder how many men will die tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我想明天还得有多少人要送命啊。

sentences.english: Tutankhamun's bone disease was crippling, but on its own would not have been fatal.
sentences.chinese: 图坦卡蒙的骨病固然严重，但还没到让他送命的地步。

sentences.english: He is a man who, to all appearances, has lost some person who is dear to him. People die of that.
sentences.chinese: 看来这人失去了一个亲人，这会送命的。

definition: to lose one's life
to die
life
to die/to perish
to throw away one's life
to lose one's life/to die/recklessly/desperately
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to risk one's life
to save/to assist/to rescue
variant of 救[jiu4]
to meet violent death/to get killed
to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end

definition: variant of 殞命|殒命[yun3 ming4]/to die/to perish
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
seriously injured
to bury a corpse/to be buried/(fig.) to die (at sea, in a fire etc)
